  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath6 be a linear group acting differentially on a manifold @xmath7 and @xmath0 its lie algebra .",
    "we denote by @xmath8 , @xmath9 or @xmath10 , the right invariant continuous - time flow generated by @xmath11 or the discrete - time flow generated by @xmath12 .",
    "more precisely , when @xmath13 , we have that @xmath14 and , when @xmath15 , we have that @xmath8 is the @xmath16-iterate of @xmath5 . when @xmath17 we just write @xmath18 . throughout this paper , we call @xmath8 a linear flow",
    ". it induces a differentiable flow on @xmath7 given by @xmath19 , where @xmath20 and @xmath21 or @xmath22 .",
    "we call these flows linearly induced flows .    take @xmath1 , where @xmath0 is a semisimple lie algebra . in @xcite it is considered a continuous - time flow generated by real semisimple element @xmath23 acting on the flag manifolds of @xmath0 : they show it is a morse - bott gradient flow , describe its fixed point set and their stable sets . in @xcite",
    "it is analized a continuous - time flow generated by an element which is the sum of two commuting elements of @xmath0 , one of which induces a gradient vector field and the other generates a one - parameter group of isometries . in the context of @xmath24 , the articles @xcite study the discrete - time flow generated by an arbitrary element @xmath25 : they characterize the structurally stable ones .    in this article",
    ", we study the dynamics of linearly induced flows @xmath8 , for both continuous and discrete times , acting on a generalized flag manifold @xmath26 of @xmath0 .",
    "this context includes , for example , volume preserving and hamiltonian linearly induced flows acting , respectively , on grassmanian manifolds and on grassmanian of isotropic subspaces , such as the grassmanian of the lagrangian subspaces .",
    "this dynamics is related with the jordan decomposition of the flow @xmath8 , which is defined in terms of the jordan decomposition of @xmath4 or @xmath5 ( see section [ subsecjordan ] ) .",
    "we also consider the dynamical aspects of linear differential equations with periodic coefficients in @xmath0 , which can be regarded as an extension of the dynamics generated by an element @xmath2 . in what follows",
    "we describe the structure of this article .",
    "we note that we recover , in this setting , the results of @xcite about flows in flag bundles with chain recurrent compact hausdorff base .    in the preliminaries we recall some notions of conley theory and of semisimple lie theory , proving some useful results .",
    "in section 3 , we recall the jordan decomposition in @xmath6 and @xmath0 and show that the flow @xmath8 can be written as a product of commuting flows @xmath27 , where @xmath28 , @xmath29 , @xmath30 are linear flows in @xmath6 which are called , respectively , the elliptic , hyperbolic and unipotent components of @xmath8 .",
    "we finish this section with a result about the good behavior of the jordan decomposition under a certain representation of @xmath6 which is related to a natural immersion of a flag manifold into a projective space .",
    "section 4 is made up of various subsections . in the first one ,",
    "we look at the linearly induced flow of @xmath8 on a flag manifold as the restriction of a linearly induced flow on a projective space . using the results of the appendix about dynamics on projective spaces and the results of @xcite about the action of a real semisimple element @xmath23 on the flag manifolds , we generalize these results characterizing the recurrent and chain recurrent sets , the finest morse decomposition , including its stable sets , in terms of the fixed points of the jordan components . for example , we get the following result .    the recurrent and chain recurrent sets of @xmath8 in the flag manifold @xmath26 are given , respectively , by @xmath31 where @xmath32 and @xmath33 are the fixed points of these flows in @xmath26 .",
    "as a byproduct , we show that the entropy of these flows always vanishes . in section 4.2",
    "we define the conformal flows as the ones whose unipotent part in the jordan decomposition is trivial , this is the kind of linear flow considered in @xcite . for these flows",
    ", we compute the conley indexes of all morse components .",
    "we note that we can compute the conley index of the attractor for every flow @xmath8 , with no restrictions .",
    "we then introduce the regular flows , which are a particular case of the conformal flows .",
    "we show that they are dense in @xmath6 or @xmath0 , which implies theorem 8.1 of @xcite about the density of continuous - time conformal flows . using this and the previous results we obtain the next result which generalizes results of @xcite obtained in the context of discrete - time flows generated by an arbitrary element @xmath34 .",
    "[ teoestab ] the following conditions are equivalent :    * @xmath8 is regular , * @xmath8 is morse - smale and * @xmath8 is structurally stable .    finally , we consider the dynamical aspects of linear differential equations with periodic coefficients in @xmath0 , which can be regarded as an extension of the dynamics generated by an element @xmath2 . in this context",
    ", we generalize floquet theory and then extend the previous results to this case .",

    "we say that a @xmath39-invariant set @xmath40 is normally hyperbolic if there exists a neighborhood of @xmath55 where the flow is conjugated to a normally hyperbolic linear flow restricted to some neighborhood of the null section .",

    "now we relate morse decompositions to chain transitivity .",
    "first let us recall that a finite collection of disjoint subsets @xmath116 defines a morse decomposition when    * each @xmath117 is compact and @xmath39-invariant , * for all @xmath87 we have @xmath118 , * if @xmath119 then @xmath120 .",
    "each set @xmath121 of a morse decomposition is called a morse component .",
    "if @xmath122 is a morse decomposition of @xmath4 , then it is immediate that @xmath4 decomposes as the disjoint union of stable sets @xmath123 .",
    "the finest morse decomposition is a morse decomposition which is contained in every other morse decomposition .",
    "the existence of a finest morse decomposition of a flow is equivalent to the finiteness of the number of chain components ( see @xcite , theorem 3.15 ) . in this case , each morse component is a chain transitive component and vice - versa .",
    "we say that the flow @xmath39 is normally hyperbolic if there exists the finest morse decomposition and their morse components are normally hyperbolic .",

    "the next proposition shows that the fixed points of the hyperbolic part of @xmath8 are morse components for the flow @xmath8 in the flag manifold .",
    "this result is proved by using proposition [ propmorse ] , which is in fact a particular case when the flag manifold is the projective space .",

    "[ teoestab ] let @xmath8 be a flow on @xmath26 , where @xmath388 with @xmath539 .",
    "then the following conditions are equivalent :    * @xmath8 is regular , * @xmath8 is morse - smale and * @xmath8 is structurally stable .    first we show that condition ( i ) implies condition ( ii ) .",
    "let @xmath555 be the jordan decomposition of @xmath8 and @xmath556 . if @xmath192 is regular , then for each @xmath159 , the set @xmath401 reduces to a point .",
    "thus , by theorem [ teomorseflag ] , it follows that @xmath557 is a finite set of fixed points . by proposition [ proplinearizacao ]",
    ", we have that each point in @xmath557 is hyperbolic .",
    "furthermore , by lemma 4.2 of @xcite p.331 , the stable and unstable manifolds , given by proposition [ propmorseflag ] , intersect transversally .",
    "thus it follows that @xmath8 is morse - smale . by a result of @xcite",
    ", it follows that condition ( ii ) implies condition ( iii ) .",
    "now we show that the negation of condition ( i ) implies the negation of condition ( iii ) .",
    "if @xmath192 is not regular , for each @xmath388 with @xmath539 , there exists a morse component @xmath396 which has infinite points .",
    "thus , by theorem [ teomorseflag ] , the same is true for @xmath557 .",

    "[ proplinearizacaofloquet ] put @xmath505 and take @xmath733 such that @xmath734 .",

    "furthermore , the stable and unstable sets of @xmath396 are diffeomorphic to vector bundles over @xmath671 .",
    "moreover , if @xmath39 is a conformal flow , then it is normally hyperbolic and its restriction to @xmath737 and @xmath738 are conjugated to linear flows .    in the next result",
    "we obtain the conley index of the attractor and , when @xmath39 is conformal , of all morse components ( see theorem 7.4 and corollary 7.8 of @xcite ) .    if @xmath512 or @xmath513 , then the conley index of the attractor @xmath739 is its homotopy class .",
    "if @xmath39 is conformal , then the conley index of the morse component @xmath671 is the homotopy class of the thom space of the vector bundle @xmath740 . in particular , we have the following isomorphism in cohomology @xmath741 where @xmath516 is the dimension of @xmath742 as a vector bunble .",
    "the cohomology coefficients are taken in @xmath517 in the general case and in @xmath518 when @xmath511 is orientable .",
    "it follows that the ( co)homology conley indexes can be computed by kneth formula , once we know the ( co)homology of the real flag manifolds . for the homology of real flag manifolds",
    "see @xcite .",

    "we have that the nilpotent component of @xmath847 is zero , while its elliptic and hyperbolic components are given , respectively , by @xmath848 in this case , the recurrent and chain recurrent sets coincide and we have two morse components : the attractor @xmath849 $ ] and the repeller @xmath850 $ ] ( see figure [ fig2](a ) ) .",
    "we also have that the elliptic component of @xmath851 is zero , while its hyperbolic and nilpotent components are given , respectively , by @xmath852 in this case , the recurrent and chain recurrent sets are different , but the morse components remain the same . the recurrent set",

    "in both cases , the stable set of the attractor is the complement of the repeller ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a semisimple lie algebra and @xmath1 . in this article </S>",
    "<S> , we relate the jordan decomposition of @xmath2 ( or @xmath3 ) with the dynamics induced on generalized flag manifolds by the right invariant continuous - time flow generated by @xmath4 ( or the discrete - time flow generated by @xmath5 ) . </S>",
    "<S> we characterize the recurrent set and the finest morse decomposition ( including its stable sets ) of these flows and show that its entropy always vanishes . </S>",
    "<S> we characterize the structurally stable ones and compute the conley index of the attractor morse component . </S>",
    "<S> when the nilpotent part of @xmath4 is trivial , we compute the conley indexes of all morse components . finally , we consider the dynamical aspects of linear differential equations with periodic coefficients in @xmath0 , which can be regarded as an extension of the dynamics generated by an element @xmath2 . in this context </S>",
    "<S> , we generalize floquet theory and extend the previous results to this case .    _ ams 2000 subject classification _ : primary : 37b35 , 22e46 , 37c20 , secondary : 37b30 , 37b40 .    _ </S>",
    "<S> key words : _ jordan decomposition , recurrence , morse decomposition , generalized flag manifolds , structural stability , conley index , floquet theory . </S>"
  ]
}
